channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024100527
item.description:
Report X-2024100527

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Alan Fozo Service Center Manager called safety to report report evidence of a spill in trailer 84740, UN1648, ACETONITRILE 3 PG II. 1 Gallon pail. Alan stated when the crew opened the trailer door on the trailer and started to unload, they found a box that looked to have been forked by a forklift. A lan stated the only evidence of the spill was the hole in the box and a damaged 1 gallon pail in the box that was dry. Alan stated it looks like the ACETONITRILE had evaporated and left no trace of the spill. Alan stated he was going to take the damaged pail and place it in a recovery pail with Pro Number in OSD. Alan stated after removing the pallet and the box from the skid, there was no spill to be cleaned other than a damaged glass pail in the box. Alan stated the box that was damaged by the forklift blade was done at the loading facility and found the damaged box at SC 106 in trailer 847 40 while unloading.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When the vac box was dropped in the yard, the bottom scrapped along the asphalt, which resulted in the chains on the door being loosened up. With chains loose, the seal on the door was not effective causing the spill to come out the top of the box.

item.title: Report E-2024100193
item.description:
Report E-2024100193

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:16 AM ET, XSB contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in South Bend, IN. The spill consists of approximately 20 gallons of 991WP609-DO Armor HP Global, which released from 1–55-gallon metal drum, due to be improper packaging by the shipper. The terminal discovered the spill from inside the shrink wrap leaking out onto the trailer floor, there were no punctures visible. The terminal has already overpacked the container into a 95-gallon metal overpack.

item.title: Report X-2024100256
item.description:
Report X-2024100256

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A spill agent at the HNBA location was presented two plastic Fedex packs suspected to contained spray paint cans. While investigating the shipments the spill agent found a single can of sprat paint in each pack. The shipments didn't have any DG markings or paperwork needed for shipment. They were placed into steel salvage packages and are being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2024100047
item.description:
Report E-2024100047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quarts of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel properly cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
